unnormalised: The study published in Lancet highlighted that nearly 60% of the Indian population carries at least 1 genetic mutation, with Î²-thalassemia being most prevalent at approx. 3.2% amongst certain communities. Further research is needed at the genomic level.
normalised: The study published in Lancet highlighted that nearly sixty percent of the Indian population carries at least one genetic mutation, with beta thalassemia being most prevalent at approximately three point two percent amongst certain communities. Further research is needed at the genomic level.
